testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
-config a remote CVG, there are several LANs behind it -there are some services in CVG's LANs -BR1 setup VPN connection with CVG -BR2 setup VPN connection with CVG -setup all wifi radio and eth interfaces as access mode -BR1 have several LANs behind it -BR2 have several LANs behind it -STA1 in BR1's LANs, STA2 in BR2's LANs
Test Procedure:
-STA1 ping STA2 -STA2 ping STA2

step.desc: Config CVG as VPN server
config CVG act as l3 VPN server
step.telnet: -v "save vpn ee-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/server_cert.pem" -v "save vpn private-key tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/server_key.pem" -v "vpn xauth-client-list ${vpn.client.list} local" -v "vpn xauth-client-list ${vpn.client.list} client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn server-ipsec-tunnel ${vpn.server.name} vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${vpn.server.name} client-list ${vpn.client.list}" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_tunnel_policy server ipsec-tunnel ${vpn.server.name}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "_debug brd info" -v "" -v "_debug brd basic" -v "" -v "" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br2.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br2.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "" -v ""

step.desc: enable ospf on eth1 if it has two arms
step.telnet: -v "routing protocol ospf advertise eth1" -v "routing protocol ospf router-id ${cvg1.cvg.lan.ip}" -v "routing protocol type ospf" -v "routing protocol enable"

step.desc: Config BR as VPN client
config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: config BR as l3 VPN client
step.telnet: -v "save vpn ca-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/cacert.pem" -v "vpn client-ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 gateway ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip} client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_tunnel_policy client ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 primary" -v "routing route-request enable" -v "_debug brd info" -v "" -v "_debug brd basic" -v "" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "" -v "" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "" -v "" -v ""

step.desc: show log buf on br
show log buf on cvg

step.multi-setvar: echo "br1.br.mgt0.1.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "br2.br.mgt0.1.route=$(echo ${br2.br.mgt0.1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.vpc1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0"

step.desc: check vpn ike sa on BR side destination to CVG public address
check vpn ike sa on CVG side destionation to BR public address
check gre tunnel on br side remote to CVG wan address, local mgt0 address ,gateway CVG public address
check gre tunnel on cvg side local to CVG wan address
On GW, will add the tunnel routes according to BR's modification
check ip route on BR
Config BR2 as VPN client
config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br2.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br2.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br2.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br2.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br2.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: config BR2 as l3 VPN client
step.telnet: -v "save vpn ca-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/cacert.pem" -v "vpn client-ipsec-tunnel ${br2.br.name}_ipsec_1 vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br2.br.name}_ipsec_1 gateway ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip} client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_tunnel_policy client ipsec-tunnel ${br2.br.name}_ipsec_1 primary" -v "routing route-request enable" -v "" -v "_debug brd info" -v "" -v "_debug brd basic" -v "" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br2.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "" -v "" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br2.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "" -v ""

step.desc: show log buf on br
show log buf on cvg
check vpn ike sa on BR side destination to CVG public address
step.telnet: -v "no routing internal-sub-network ${br2.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "no routing internal-sub-network ${br2.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br2.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br2.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "show vpn ike sa"

step.desc: check vpn ike sa on CVG side destionation to BR public address
check gre tunnel on br side remote to CVG wan address, local mgt0 address ,gateway CVG public address
check gre tunnel on cvg side local to CVG wan address
On GW, will add the tunnel routes according to BR's modification
check ip route on BR
setup eth interface as access mode
configure vpc1
step.telnet: -v "user-profile sta qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1"

step.desc: Laptop1 connect to lan port eth2
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
set all wired interface as access mode eth1 access br2.vpc1.vlan
step.telnet: -v "security-object lan1" -v "security-object lan1 default-user-profile-attr 1" -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br2.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1" -v "int eth1 mac-learning enable" -v "interface eth1 security-object lan1"

step.desc: br2.vpc1 get ip addr from dhcp server of mgt0.1
set br2.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
Enable debug, Check BR connectivities
BR ping br1.vpc1
BR ping br2.vpc1
br1.vpc1 ping cvg.vpc1
br2.vpc1 ping cvg.vpc1
enable debug
enable debug
enable debug
-the life time of the two tunnels are different
step.telnet: -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 ike phase1 lifetime 180" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 ike phase2 lifetime 230"

step.desc: -the life time of the two tunnels are different
step.telnet: -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br2.br.name}_ipsec_1 ike phase1 lifetime 400" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br2.br.name}_ipsec_1 ike phase2 lifetime 450"

step.desc: check the phase to lifetime
step.log-match: -b "configuration name:.+${br1.tunnel.name}_ipsec_1.+" -ps p "phase1 proposal" -ps p "lifetime time 180 sec" -ps p "phase2 proposal" -e "lifetime time 230 sec" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: check the phase to lifetime
step.log-match: -b "configuration name:.+${br2.tunnel.name}_ipsec_1.+" -ps p "phase1 proposal" -ps p "lifetime time 400 sec" -ps p "phase2 proposal" -e "lifetime time 450 sec" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: -check the rekey on two tunnels is correct
BR layer-3-tunnel status should be correct
check vpn ike sa on CVG side destionation to BR public address
check gre tunnel on cvg side local to CVG wan address
On GW, will add the tunnel routes according to BR's modification
check ip route on BR
save cvg log
move the file to current log dir
check the rekey of tunnel0 on CVG is correct
check the rekey of tunnel0 on BR1 is correct
step.telnet: -v "show log buf | in IKE" -v "" -v "" -v "clear log buf"

step.desc: -check the rekey on two tunnels is correct
layer-3-tunnel status should be correct
check vpn ike sa on CVG side destionation to BR public address
check gre tunnel on cvg side local to CVG wan address
On GW, will add the tunnel routes according to BR's modification
check ip route on BR
save cvg log
move the file to current log dir
check the rekey of tunnel0 on CVG is correct
check the rekey of tunnel0 on BR1 is correct
step.telnet: -v "show log buf | in IKE" -v "" -v "" -v "clear log buf"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 ping cvg.vpc1
br2.vpc1 ping cvg.vpc1
